metadata.feature_description: Monitors and reports Active Directory connection status and availability

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Navigate to AD Settings and Access Network Status

steps.action: Login to DNN as host user
steps.expected: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account
steps.actual: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Extensions > Authentication Systems > DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication > Site Settings
steps.actual: AD authentication settings page displayed with configuration options

steps.action: View current AD configuration (Root Domain: persistence-test.local, User: testuser)
steps.actual: Configuration displayed showing Root Domain: persistence-test.local, User Name: testuser

steps.action: Click 'Update Authentication Settings' to trigger network status check
steps.expected: Network status check performed and results displayed
steps.actual: Network status displayed with FAIL status for all components

steps.action: Review status message after clicking Update Authentication Settings
steps.expected: Global Catalog status should be displayed
steps.actual: Global Catalog status displayed as 'FAIL' in red error message box

steps.action: Review status message after clicking Update Authentication Settings
steps.actual: LDAP status displayed as 'Accessing LDAP: FAIL'

steps.action: Review status message after clicking Update Authentication Settings
steps.expected: Root Domain status should be displayed
steps.actual: Root Domain status displayed as 'Checking Root Domain: FAIL'

steps.action: Review status message after clicking Update Authentication Settings
steps.expected: Network Domains status should be displayed
steps.actual: Network Domains status displayed as 'Find all domains in network: Could not access LDAP to obtain domains info'

steps.action: Review status messages for proper localization
steps.expected: Status messages should be localized and readable
steps.actual: Status messages displayed in English with proper formatting: 'Accessing Global Catalog', 'Checking Root Domain', 'Accessing LDAP', 'Find all domains in network'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify status updates after configuration changes

steps.action: Click 'Update Authentication Settings' with AD enabled
steps.expected: Status should refresh and display current connection status
steps.actual: Status message displayed in red error box immediately after clicking Update, showing current connection status (all FAIL due to no AD server)

observations: The Network Status Monitoring feature is accessed by clicking 'Update Authentication Settings' in the AD provider Site Settings
Status is displayed as a module message (red for errors, green for success based on code review)
The feature correctly reports status for: Global Catalog, Root Domain, LDAP, and Network Domains
Since there is no actual Active Directory server configured in the test environment, all status checks return FAIL - this is expected behavior

Code review (ADSIProvider.cs:479-583) confirms the GetNetworkStatus() method checks four components: ADSINetwork (Global Catalog), RootEntry (Root Domain), LDAPAccessible (LDAP), and RefCollection (Network Domains)
The status messages are localized through the LocalizedStatus() method in Settings.ascx.cs
Testing with a valid AD connection was not possible without an actual Active Directory server in the environment
